original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of administrators of the Saṅgha:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs shing shin tu 'da' bar byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs shing shin tu 'da' bar byed pa /
translated: those who slander the Tathāgata and commit serious transgressions,🔽and those who do not.

original: gsungs pa bzhin mi smra ba /
analyzed: gsungs pa bzhin mi smra ba /
translated: As it is said, he does not speak.

original: chos bzhin mi smra ba /
analyzed: chos bzhin mi smra ba /
translated: He does not speak in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos kyi rjes bzhin mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos kyi rjes bzhin mi byed pa ste /
translated: He does not act in accordance with the Dharma and the pursuit of the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa chos bzhin du brjod /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa chos bzhin du brjod /
translated: He expresses what is not the Dharma as if it were the Dharma.

original: chos la chos ma yin par brjod cing de dag la smra ba'i lan slar glon pa ni /
analyzed: chos la chos ma yin par brjod cing de dag la smra ba'i lan slar glon pa ni /
translated: He expresses the Dharma as if it were not the Dharma. He does not respond to those who speak to him.

original: chos mthun pa dag gis smad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa dag gis smad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: He is a person who is criticized by those who are in accord with the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of administrators of the Saṅgha:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba mi 'debs shing shin tu 'da' bar mi byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba mi 'debs shing shin tu 'da' bar mi byed pa /
translated: They do not slander the Tathāgata and do not transgress his teachings.

original: gsungs pa bzhin du smra ba /
analyzed: gsungs pa bzhin du smra ba /
translated: They speak in accordance with what is said.

original: chos bzhin du smra ba /
analyzed: chos bzhin du smra ba /
translated: They speak in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su chos bzhin byed de /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su chos bzhin byed de /
translated: They act in accordance with the Dharma and the pursuit of the Dharma.

original: chos la chos bzhin du brjod /🔽chos ma yin @37a *//🔽pa la ni /
analyzed: chos la chos bzhin du brjod / chos ma yin @37a *// pa la ni /
translated: They express the Dharma as if it were the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin par brjod pa /
analyzed: chos ma yin par brjod pa /
translated: They express what is not the Dharma as if it were not the Dharma.

original: de dag la smras pa'i lan slar mi glon pa'i chos mthun pa dag gis smad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la smras pa'i lan slar mi glon pa'i chos mthun pa dag gis smad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not respond to those who speak to them. They are not people who are criticized by those who are in accord with the Dharma.

original: mdo bar ma ste /
analyzed: mdo bar ma ste /
translated: The middle sūtra says:

original: skur ba 'debs par byed pa dang // sdig pa nye bar bcas pa dang // kha na ma tho byas pa dang // bar ma'i mdor ni yang dag bsdus //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs par byed pa dang // sdig pa nye bar bcas pa dang // kha na ma tho byas pa dang // bar ma'i mdor ni yang dag bsdus //
translated: “Those who slander, those who are sinful, those who have committed offenses, and those who are neutral are included in the middle part.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang chos ma yin pa la chos su brjod /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang chos ma yin pa la chos su brjod /
translated: If a monk who is in charge of the affairs of the Saṅgha says that what is not the Dharma is the Dharma,

original: chos la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
translated: and if he says that what is the Dharma is not the Dharma, then he has two qualities.

original: bsdig par bya'o //🔽smad par bya'o //🔽bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdig par bya'o // smad par bya'o // bskrad par bya'o //
translated: He should be threatened.🔽He should be reviled.🔽He should be expelled.

original: spang bar bya'o //🔽phyogs med par bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya'o // phyogs med par bya'o //
translated: He should be abandoned.🔽He should be isolated.

original: zhum par bya'o //
analyzed: zhum par bya'o //
translated: He should be discouraged.

original: spa gong bar bya'o //
analyzed: spa gong bar bya'o //
translated: He should be made to feel remorse.

original: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams bskyed par bya'o //🔽nar bar bya /
analyzed: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams bskyed par bya'o // nar bar bya /
translated: He should be made to feel doubt, uncertainty, and regret.🔽He should be brought down.

original: gnad du phebs par bya /
analyzed: gnad du phebs par bya /
translated: He should be brought to ruin.

original: skyon can du bya'o //
analyzed: skyon can du bya'o //
translated: He should be made to have faults.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang chos la chos su brjod pas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang chos la chos su brjod pas /
translated: If a monk who is in charge of the affairs of the Saṅgha says that what is the Dharma is the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /🔽bsdig par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni / bsdig par mi bya'o //
translated: and if he says that what is not the Dharma is not the Dharma, then he has two qualities.🔽He should not be threatened.

original: smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be reviled.

original: bskrad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bskrad par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not expel them.

original: spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not abandon them.

original: phyogs med par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs med par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not leave them alone.

original: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not give rise to doubts, uncertainty, or regret.

original: nar bar mi bya /🔽gnad du phebs par mi bya /
analyzed: nar bar mi bya / gnad du phebs par mi bya /
translated: Do not be careless.🔽Do not be negligent.

original: skyon can du mi bya'o //🔽dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: skyon can du mi bya'o // dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos ma yin pa la ni /
translated: Do not be at fault.

original: chos su brjod /🔽chos la ni /
analyzed: chos su brjod / chos la ni /
translated: If a monk who is in charge of the affairs of the saṅgha describes what is not the Dharma as the Dharma,🔽and describes the Dharma as not being the Dharma, he will be at fault

original: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de @37b gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de @37b gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
translated: if he possesses those two qualities.

original: nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /🔽dogs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur te / dogs pa dang bcas /

original: the tshom dang bcas /
analyzed: the tshom dang bcas /

analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas /

analyzed: bya ba dang bcas pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bslang du med pa'o; ;dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang chos la chos su brjod / chos ma yin pa la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
translated: If a monk who is in charge of the affairs of the saṅgha describes what is the Dharma as the Dharma,🔽and describes what is not the Dharma as not being the Dharma, he will not be at fault

original: nyes pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if he possesses those two qualities.🔽He will not be at fault

original: dogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin /
analyzed: dogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin /
translated: if he is not doubtful,

original: the tshom dang bcas pa ma yin /
analyzed: the tshom dang bcas pa ma yin /
translated: He is not doubtful.

original: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa ma yin /
translated: He is not regretful.

original: bya ba dang bcas pa ma yin /
analyzed: bya ba dang bcas pa ma yin /

analyzed: gtsang ba dang / bslang du rung ba'o // dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos ma yin pa la ni /
translated: He is pure and fit to be appointed.

original: chos su brjod /🔽chos la ni /
analyzed: chos su brjod / chos la ni /
translated: If the Saṅgha’s steward says that what is contrary to the Dharma is Dharma

original: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
translated: and that what is Dharma is contrary to the Dharma, he has two qualities:

analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: nye ba'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / rjes su gdung ba dang bcas pa dang / gdung bar bya ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: He has blameworthy qualities, he has blameworthy qualities that are harmful, he has blameworthy qualities that are distressing, and he has blameworthy qualities that are to be regretted.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos la chos su brjod /🔽chos ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos la chos su brjod / chos ma yin pa la ni /
translated: If the Saṅgha’s steward says that what is Dharma is Dharma

original: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /
translated: and that what is contrary to the Dharma is contrary to the Dharma, he has two qualities:

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he does not have blameworthy qualities.🔽He does not have blameworthy qualities, he does not have blameworthy qualities that are harmful, he does not have blameworthy qualities that are distressing, and he does not have blameworthy qualities that are to be regretted.

analyzed: nye ba'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin; gnod pa dang bcas pa ma yin / rjes su gdung ba dang bcas pa ma yin /
translated: He is not guilty of a serious offense, nor is he guilty of an offense.🔽He is not guilty of an offense that is a basis for gossip, nor is he guilty of an offense that is a cause of dispute.

analyzed: gdung bar bya ba dang bcas pa ma yin no // dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos ma yin pa la @38a *//
translated: He is not guilty of an offense that is a cause of regret, nor is he guilty of an offense that is a cause of burning.

original: chos su brjod /
analyzed: chos su brjod /
translated: “The monk who is the manager of the saṅgha’s affairs, who speaks of what is contrary to the Dharma as being the Dharma,🔽and who speaks of what is the Dharma as being contrary to the Dharma,

original: chos la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: chos la chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de dang ldan pa ni /
translated: possesses a Dharma that

original: byis pa / glen pa /
analyzed: byis pa / glen pa /

original: mi gsal ba /
analyzed: mi gsal ba /
translated: unclear,

original: mi mkhas pa /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa /
translated: unskilled,

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and not that of a holy person.

analyzed: bdag nyid dregs pa ma spangs pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro //

original: nye ba'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas /🔽cung zad tsam yang mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur /
analyzed: nye ba'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas / cung zad tsam yang mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur /
translated: He is guilty of an offense that is a basis for gossip.🔽He is guilty of an offense that is a cause of dispute.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa mang po bgrang du med cing /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa mang po bgrang du med cing /
translated: He is guilty of an offense that is a cause of regret.🔽He is guilty of an offense that is a cause of burning.

translated: They will increase immeasurably and boundlessly, and like an arrow shot, they will fall down dead. After death, they will be born in the hells, which are the lower realms, the bad rebirths, the fall.🔽They will be born in the lower realms.🔽They will be born in the bad rebirths.

analyzed: log par ltung bar 'gro / ngan song du skye / ngan 'gror skye /
translated: They will go to the fall.🔽They will be born in the lower realms.🔽They will be born in the bad rebirths.

original: log par ltung bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par ltung bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will be born in the fall.

original: yun ring por 'phyan cing /
analyzed: yun ring por 'phyan cing /

analyzed: 'khor bar 'phyan pas na /

original: 'khor ba las slar mi ldog go /
analyzed: 'khor ba las slar mi ldog go /

original: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos la chos su brjod cing /🔽chos ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhal ta pa gang gis chos la chos su brjod cing / chos ma yin pa la ni /
translated: “The one who is in charge of the saṅgha’s affairs should speak of the Dharma as the Dharma🔽and speak of what is not the Dharma as not the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni /🔽mkhas pa / gsal ba /🔽yid rno ba /
analyzed: chos ma yin par brjod pa'i chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ni / mkhas pa / gsal ba / yid rno ba /
translated: The one who has these two dharmas🔽should be known as a wise,🔽clear,🔽intelligent,

original: shes pa; skyes bu dam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa; skyes bu dam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and holy person.

analyzed: bdag nyid dregs pa spangs pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin par gyur /

translated: The training in superior attitude is the training in the four noble truths.🔽The training in wisdom is the training in the twelve links of dependent origination.🔽The training in the perfections is the training in the six perfections.🔽The training in the rules is the training

original: mthong bas bslang ba dang / bshags pas bslang ba dang / snga nas ma byas pas bslang ba dang / mthol bas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas bslang ba dang / bshags pas bslang ba dang / snga nas ma byas pas bslang ba dang / mthol bas bslang ba'o //
translated: the restoration of the precepts by means of insight, the restoration of the precepts by means of confession, the restoration of the precepts by means of the uncommitted, and the restoration of the precepts by means of the vow.

original: rton pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rton pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of reliance:

original: don la rton gyi yi ge la ma yin pa dang / chos la rton gyi gang zag la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi bkri ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don la rton gyi yi ge la ma yin pa dang / chos la rton gyi gang zag la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi bkri ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o //
translated: relying on the meaning rather than the letter, relying on the teaching rather than the person, relying on the definitive meaning rather than the interpretable meaning, and relying on gnosis rather than consciousness.🔽There are four kinds of preceptors:

original: mkhan po la rnam pa bzhi ste; mkhan po chos kyis sdud la zang zing gis ma yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: mkhan po la rnam pa bzhi ste; mkhan po chos kyis sdud la zang zing gis ma yin pa'ang yod /
translated: there are those who gather disciples through the Dharma but not through material things,

original: zang zing gis sdud la chos kyis ma yin pa'ang yod /
analyzed: zang zing gis sdud la chos kyis ma yin pa'ang yod /
translated: there are those who gather disciples through material things but not through the Dharma,

original: mkhan po chos kyis sdud cing zang zing gis sdud pa yang yod; mkhan po chos kyis mi sdud cing zang zing gis ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: mkhan po chos kyis sdud cing zang zing gis sdud pa yang yod; mkhan po chos kyis mi sdud cing zang zing gis ma yin pa yod de /
translated: there are those who gather disciples both through the Dharma and through material things, and there are those who gather disciples neither through the Dharma nor through material things.

original: de la mkhan po gang gis chos kyis sdud la zang zing gis ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po la ni /
analyzed: de la mkhan po gang gis chos kyis sdud la zang zing gis ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po la ni /
translated: The preceptor who supports you through the Dharma and not through material things,

original: shes par byas te gnas par bya'o //🔽de la mkhan po gang zang zing gis sdud la chos kyis ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po la ni /
analyzed: shes par byas te gnas par bya'o // de la mkhan po gang zang zing gis sdud la chos kyis ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po la ni /
translated: you should stay with him, having understood.

original: bltas te 'gro bar bya'o //🔽de la mkhan po gang chos kyis sdud la zang zing @43b gis kyang sdud pa de lta bu'i mkhan po ni /
analyzed: bltas te 'gro bar bya'o // de la mkhan po gang chos kyis sdud la zang zing @43b gis kyang sdud pa de lta bu'i mkhan po ni /
translated: The preceptor who supports you through material things and not through the Dharma, you should go to him, having looked.

original: gsher zin kyang nam 'tsho'i bar du gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: gsher zin kyang nam 'tsho'i bar du gnas par gyis shig /
translated: The preceptor who supports you through the Dharma and also through material things, you should stay with him as long as you live, even if he is sick.

original: de la mkhan po gang chos kyis kyang mi sdud zang zing gis kyang ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po ni; ma 'gro zhes bsgo yang mi lta bar 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la mkhan po gang chos kyis kyang mi sdud zang zing gis kyang ma yin pa de lta bu'i mkhan po ni; ma 'gro zhes bsgo yang mi lta bar 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The preceptor who does not support you through the Dharma or through material things, you should go to him without looking, even if he tells you to stay.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
translated: There are four ways of attracting people:

original: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams so //
translated: generosity, kind words, helpful behavior, and practicing what one preaches.

original: sman rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sman rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of medicine:

original: sman nyid mi rung la nye 'khor mi rung ba yang yod /🔽sman nyid mi rung la nye 'khor rung ba yang yod /
analyzed: sman nyid mi rung la nye 'khor mi rung ba yang yod / sman nyid mi rung la nye 'khor rung ba yang yod /
translated: There are medicines that are not suitable but whose vicinity is suitable.🔽There are medicines that are not suitable but whose vicinity is suitable.

original: sman nyid rung la nye 'khor mi rung ba yang yod /
analyzed: sman nyid rung la nye 'khor mi rung ba yang yod /
translated: There are medicines that are suitable but whose vicinity is unsuitable.

original: sman nyid rung la nye 'khor rung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: sman nyid rung la nye 'khor rung ba yang yod do //
translated: There are medicines that are suitable and whose vicinity is suitable.

original: don gyi mthu bzhi la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi sman gnang ste /
analyzed: don gyi mthu bzhi la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi sman gnang ste /
translated: The Blessed One permitted the medicines of the monks based on four kinds of potency:

original: dus kyi mthu dang / yul gyi mthu dang / gang zag gi mthu dang / byung ba'i mthu'o //
analyzed: dus kyi mthu dang / yul gyi mthu dang / gang zag gi mthu dang / byung ba'i mthu'o //
translated: the potency of time, the potency of place, the potency of person, and the potency of occurrence.

original: spang ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spang ba la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Abandonment is of four kinds:

original: kha na ma tho ba dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / phan gdags pa dang / dam pa'i chos la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / phan gdags pa dang / dam pa'i chos la gnas pa'o //
translated: abandonment of wrongdoing, abandonment of punishment, abandonment of benefit, and abandonment of the true Dharma.

original: rjes su gnang ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Permission is of four kinds:

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / chad pas ma bcad pa dang / phan gdags pa dang / bde bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / chad pas ma bcad pa dang / phan gdags pa dang / bde bar spyod pa'o //
translated: permission of non-wrongdoing, permission of non-punishment, permission of benefit, and permission of comfortable practice.

original: yul rnam pa bzhir de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa bcas te /
analyzed: yul rnam pa bzhir de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa bcas te /
translated: The training of the disciples of the Tathagata is prescribed with regard to four objects.

original: ye shes kyi yul dang / chos kyi yul dang / gang zag gi yul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul dang / chos kyi yul dang / gang zag gi yul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lo //
translated: The object of knowledge, the object of Dharma, the object of persons, and the object of miracles.

original: las rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: las rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of actions:

original: phan gdags pa'i las dang / nan tur gyi las dang / chad pa'i las dang / spyod pa la gnas pa'i @44a *//🔽las rnams so //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i las dang / nan tur gyi las dang / chad pa'i las dang / spyod pa la gnas pa'i @44a *// las rnams so //
translated: The action of benefit, the action of punishment, the action of penalty, and the action of abiding in practice.🔽In brief, the five actions are:

original: mdor na / las la khas len dad pa dang // 'jebs par bcas pa'i las lnga dang // rnam dag las dang 'dul ba dang // nan tur chad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: mdor na / las la khas len dad pa dang // 'jebs par bcas pa'i las lnga dang // rnam dag las dang 'dul ba dang // nan tur chad pa de bzhin no //
translated: The action of accepting, the action of five kinds of offerings, the action of purification, the action of discipline, and the action of punishment.

original: las khas blang ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: las khas blang ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of accepting actions:

original: bdag nyid kyi las byed pa dang / mngon sum du gyur nas khas len pa dang / dad pa 'bul ba dang / rang gi lta ba mi brjod pa dang / cang mi smra bar khas len pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi las byed pa dang / mngon sum du gyur nas khas len pa dang / dad pa 'bul ba dang / rang gi lta ba mi brjod pa dang / cang mi smra bar khas len pa rnams so //
translated: The action of oneself, the action of accepting in the presence, the action of offering faith, the action of not expressing one's view, and the action of accepting in silence.

original: mtshams kyi nang du mngon sum du mi gnas pa lngas dad pa byin pa'i las bya'i /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du mngon sum du mi gnas pa lngas dad pa byin pa'i las bya'i /
translated: In the middle, the five who are not present in person should be given faith.

original: mang po mngon sum du 'dus pa'i nang du ni /
analyzed: mang po mngon sum du 'dus pa'i nang du ni /
translated: In the middle of a gathering of many,🔽it is not.

original: ma yin te; rkun gnas dang / so sor gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rjes su phyogs pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te; rkun gnas dang / so sor gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rjes su phyogs pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba'o //
translated: The five who are not present in person are: the suspended, the separately residing, the non-resident, the sympathizer, and the nun-corrupter.

original: ma byas par mi gnang ba'i las bya ba lnga ni /
analyzed: ma byas par mi gnang ba'i las bya ba lnga ni /
translated: The five actions that are not to be done without being agreed upon are:

original: gnas 'di zhes bya bar khyod la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas 'di zhes bya bar khyod la bya'o //
translated: “It will be done to you in this place.”

original: 'dir dge 'dun gyi nang du khyod la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge 'dun gyi nang du khyod la bya'o //
translated: “It will be done to you in the Saṅgha here.”

original: gnas gzhan gyi dge 'dun dag gi nang du khyod la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi dge 'dun dag gi nang du khyod la bya'o //
translated: “It will be done to you in the Saṅghas of other places.”

original: nyes pa de lta bu khyod la bya'o /
analyzed: nyes pa de lta bu khyod la bya'o /
translated: “This fault will be done to you.”

original: zhes des de la nyes pas bsdigs nas nyes pa rab tu bzhag ste /🔽dam dem dang bcas /
analyzed: zhes des de la nyes pas bsdigs nas nyes pa rab tu bzhag ste / dam dem dang bcas /
translated: Having threatened him with a fault, he should be placed in a fault.🔽Having made it firm,

original: 'jebs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'jebs pa dang bcas /
translated: having made it clear,

original: gseb tu dbyung ba dang bcas par byas nas gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gseb tu dbyung ba dang bcas par byas nas gtong ba'o //
translated: having made it suitable to be brought out, he should be released.

original: bshags pa'i las dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i las dang / bgo ba'i las dang / rjes su gnang ba'i las dang / spyod pa la gnas pa'i las so //
analyzed: bshags pa'i las dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i las dang / bgo ba'i las dang / rjes su gnang ba'i las dang / spyod pa la gnas pa'i las so //
translated: the rite of confession, the rite of consecration, the rite of distribution, the rite of permission, and the rite of abiding in the practice.

original: rnam par dag pa'i las lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i las lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of pure rites:

original: chad pa @44b dang / gzhi nas bslang ba'i chad pa dang / yid mgu ba dang / gzhi nas bslang ba'i yid mgu ba dang / dbyung ba rnams so //
analyzed: chad pa @44b dang / gzhi nas bslang ba'i chad pa dang / yid mgu ba dang / gzhi nas bslang ba'i yid mgu ba dang / dbyung ba rnams so //
translated: the rite of punishment, the rite of reinstatement from punishment, the rite of reconciliation, the rite of reinstatement from reconciliation, and the rite of expulsion.

original: gdul ba'i dngos po lnga ste /
analyzed: gdul ba'i dngos po lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of objects to be disciplined:

original: bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang bskrad pa dang / slar bsdum pa dang / spang ba rnams so //
analyzed: bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang bskrad pa dang / slar bsdum pa dang / spang ba rnams so //
translated: the rite of threat, the rite of condemnation, the rite of banishment, the rite of reconciliation, and the rite of relinquishment.

original: smad pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: smad pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of objects of condemnation:

original: bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / bsdum pa dang / spang pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / bsdum pa dang / spang pa rnams so //
translated: the rite of threat, the rite of condemnation, the rite of banishment, the rite of reconciliation, and the rite of relinquishment.

original: chad pa'i las rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: chad pa'i las rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of punitive rites:

original: de dag spang ba'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spang ba'i bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: up to the rite of relinquishment.

original: mdor na / dge 'dun nang na spyod pa gnyis //
analyzed: mdor na / dge 'dun nang na spyod pa gnyis //
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of conduct in the Saṅgha:

original: gnas brtan bag med sgo gnyis dang // shed dman gyur dang rtsod pa dang // bdag dang bdag shes de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan bag med sgo gnyis dang // shed dman gyur dang rtsod pa dang // bdag dang bdag shes de bzhin no //
translated: the one who is self-centered, and the one who knows himself.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi drung du 'gro ba na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi drung du 'gro ba na /
translated: When a monk who is a regular attendant in the Saṅgha goes to the Saṅgha,

original: chos rnam pa lngas dran pa nang du nye bar bzhag ste dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa lngas dran pa nang du nye bar bzhag ste dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: he should go to the Saṅgha with five aspects of mindfulness well-established within himself.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rim gror bcas pa dang / bsti stang du bcas pa dang / 'jigs pa'i dbang du gyur par bcas pa dang / dman pa'i yid du bcas pa dang / phyag dar ba dang mnyam pa'i sems dang / stan la 'dug par mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rim gror bcas pa dang / bsti stang du bcas pa dang / 'jigs pa'i dbang du gyur par bcas pa dang / dman pa'i yid du bcas pa dang / phyag dar ba dang mnyam pa'i sems dang / stan la 'dug par mkhas pa'o //
translated: He should go with respect, with deference, with a sense of fear, with a humble mind, with a mind like a newly-oiled wheel, and skilled in sitting down on his seat.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis gzhan yang chos rnam pa lngas nang du dran pa nye bar bzhag ste dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis gzhan yang chos rnam pa lngas nang du dran pa nye bar bzhag ste dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: A monk who is a regular attendant in the Saṅgha should also go to the Saṅgha with five other aspects of mindfulness well-established within himself.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / snyan par smra ba dang / tshig rtsub por mi smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / snyan par smra ba dang / tshig rtsub por mi smra ba rnams so //
translated: a loving mind, a helpful mind, a compassionate mind, speaking pleasantly, and not speaking harshly.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang @45a *//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang @45a *//
translated: In the Saṅgha

original: na chos ma yin par rtsod pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: na chos ma yin par rtsod pa'ang yod de /
translated: there is also a dispute about what is not the Dharma.

original: de la dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyi nang na spyod pa'i dge slong gis chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs la brten par bya'o //
translated: In that case, a monk who is a practitioner in the Saṅgha should rely on the side that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang na rang gi lta ba brjod nas stan las langs nas 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rang gi lta ba brjod nas stan las langs nas 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: Or, having expressed his own view, he should rise from his seat and leave.

original: de'i gleng gzhi mi dkrugs par rnal 'byor du brtson par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gleng gzhi mi dkrugs par rnal 'byor du brtson par gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should not stir up the basis for that dispute, but should abide in striving in spiritual practice.

original: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas brtan gyis dge slong ni bsdigs par bya'o //🔽tshar gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i gnas brtan gyis dge slong ni bsdigs par bya'o // tshar gcad par bya'o //
translated: An elder monk who possesses five qualities should be censured,🔽should be suppressed,

original: spang bar bya'o //🔽phyogs med par bya'o //🔽sma dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya'o // phyogs med par bya'o // sma dbab par bya'o //
translated: should be expelled,🔽should be banished,

original: spa gong bar bya'o //
analyzed: spa gong bar bya'o //
translated: should be humiliated,🔽should be intimidated,

original: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams skye bar bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa dang / the tshom dang / 'gyod pa rnams skye bar bya'o //
translated: and should be made to feel remorseful and doubtful.

original: dam dem du bcas /
analyzed: dam dem du bcas /
translated: He is not to be trusted.

original: 'jebs par bcas /
analyzed: 'jebs par bcas /
translated: He is not to be relied upon.🔽He is not to be respected.🔽He is not to be honored.

original: gsob tu dbyung bar bcas par bya ste /
analyzed: gsob tu dbyung bar bcas par bya ste /
translated: He is not to be offered the requisites.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul khrims ngan pa yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa yin /
translated: He has bad morality.

original: tshul khrims la nyes pa byung /
analyzed: tshul khrims la nyes pa byung /
translated: He has faults in his morality.

original: log par lta ba yin /
analyzed: log par lta ba yin /
translated: He has wrong views.

original: phyin ci log tu lta zhing ngo tsha med pa yin /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta zhing ngo tsha med pa yin /
translated: He has mistaken views and is shameless.

original: 'khor lo tsha med cing rgol ba dang slar rgol ba'i dge slong rnams 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'khon pa dang / 'khrugs pa rnams su skul ba yin /
analyzed: 'khor lo tsha med cing rgol ba dang slar rgol ba'i dge slong rnams 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'khon pa dang / 'khrugs pa rnams su skul ba yin /
translated: He encourages monks who are debaters and counter-debaters to fight, quarrel, argue, and create disputes.

original: rgol ba dang / slar rgol ba'i dge slong rnams chos ma yin pa la brten du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang / slar rgol ba'i dge slong rnams chos ma yin pa la brten du 'jug pa'o //
translated: He causes monks who are debaters and counter-debaters to rely on what is not Dharma.

original: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni dge bsnyen ma rnams kyis ma dad par tshor bar bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni dge bsnyen ma rnams kyis ma dad par tshor bar bya bar rigs te /
translated: Monks who have five qualities should be known as unworthy of offerings by the lay disciples.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: khyim pa rnams la kha zer ba dang / khyim pa rnams la mi snyan par smra ba dang / khyim pa rnams kyi skyon nas brjod @45b ba dang / khyim pa rnams la don ma yin pa dang / mi phan pa'i rnyed pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams la kha zer ba dang / khyim pa rnams la mi snyan par smra ba dang / khyim pa rnams kyi skyon nas brjod @45b ba dang / khyim pa rnams la don ma yin pa dang / mi phan pa'i rnyed pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: They slander householders, speak unpleasantly to householders, speak about the faults of householders, and cause householders to lose their wealth and be unhappy.

original: gzhan yang chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni dge bsnyen phas ma dad par tshor bar bya ba rigs te; lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni dge bsnyen phas ma dad par tshor bar bya ba rigs te; lnga gang zhe na /
translated: “There are five other reasons why a monk should be made to feel unwelcome by the laypeople. What are the five?

original: sangs rgyas la ngan du brjod pa dang / chos la ngan du brjod pa dang / dge 'dun la ngan du brjod pa dang / mi spyad pa spyod pa dang / dge slong gi bslab pa la ma mos pa'o //🔽chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge bsnyen ni dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed khas dbub par 'os te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ngan du brjod pa dang / chos la ngan du brjod pa dang / dge 'dun la ngan du brjod pa dang / mi spyad pa spyod pa dang / dge slong gi bslab pa la ma mos pa'o // chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i dge bsnyen ni dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed khas dbub par 'os te /
translated: Speaking badly of the Buddha, speaking badly of the Dharma, speaking badly of the Saṅgha, engaging in improper conduct, and not being interested in the training of the monks.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: “There are five other reasons why a layperson should be made to sit on the floor with his head covered. What are the five?

analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnam pa dang ldan pa'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa ni rtsod pa zhi bar byed mi nus te /

analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: mdor na / rjes su bstan pa brtsod  pa dang // las dang rgol ba 'dzin pa dang // chos ma yin pa mdo sde 'dul //

analyzed: ma bskos byung dang nyes de bzhin //

analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa ni rjes su ston par byed mi nus te /
translated: A Vinaya holder with five aspects is unable to instruct.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: slar dkar po'i phyogs su bzlog pa'ang rnam pa lngar brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa ni rtsod pa zhi bar byed mi nus pa yin te /
translated: A Vinaya holder with five aspects is unable to pacify disputes.

original: lnga gang zhen /
analyzed: lnga gang zhen /
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: des don sbyin pa la shin tu rnam par ma dag cing gcig nas gcig tu bsgo ba yin te /

analyzed: slar dkar po'i phyogs su bzlog pa'ang rnam pa lngar brjod par bya'o // chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan na /
